title: Fact Check: Video of a bus accident from 2019 falsely shared as PIA flight crash in Karachi | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
Following the horrific crash of an ill-fated Pakistan International Airlines (PIA) flight in Karachi on May 22, 2020, with 99 people on board, several videos are making the rounds on the internet. One such video claims to be of the passengers just before the crash.

“The pia plane crashes before landing at Karachi international airport” – the caption read.

At the time of filing this report, the above post had more than 1,000 shares on Facebook.

NewsMobile fact-checked the video and found that the video is old and not related to the PIA crash.

On closely examining the video, we noted that the interior appeared to resemble that of a bus rather than an aircraft. Moreover, the date (which was blacked out) in the video read ‘2019-09’.

We then extracted the keyframes of the video and put them through Reverse Image Search. The results showed numerous YouTube and Facebook links to the same video, which was uploaded in 2019.

In the original video, the date visible on the top is September 28, 2019. Also, according to the description of the video, the video is of a bus accident of one of the vehicles of Faisal Movers–a transportation company in Pakistan.

NewsMobile did not find any official report on the incident. However, the above information confirms that the video is of a bus accident from 2019. Hence, it is established that the video in question has no connection with the PIA plane crash in Karachi.

Meanwhile, according to a Pakistan daily, 97 people out of 99 onboard the plane lost their lives, while two passengers have survived. Read more about the crash here.
